   19: %%
   20: -module(instrument_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   23: 
   24: -export([allocations_enabled/1, allocations_disabled/1, allocations_ramv/1,
   25:          carriers_enabled/1, carriers_disabled/1]).
   26: 
   27: -export([test_all_alloc/2, test_per_alloc/2, test_format/3, test_abort/1,
   28:          generate_test_blocks/0, churn_memory/0]).
   29: 
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: 
   32: suite() ->
   33:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   34:      {timetrap,{minutes,5}}].
   35: 
   36: all() -> 
   37:     [allocations_enabled, allocations_disabled, allocations_ramv,
   38:      carriers_enabled, carriers_disabled].
   39: 
   40: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   41:     case test_server:is_asan() of
   42: 	true ->
   43: 	    %% No point testing own allocators under address sanitizer.
   44: 	    {skip, "Address sanitizer"};
   45: 	false ->
   46: 	    Config
   47:     end.
   48: 
   49: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   50:     ok.
   51: 
   52: 
   53: -define(GENERATED_SBC_BLOCK_COUNT, 1000).
   54: -define(GENERATED_MBC_BLOCK_COUNT, ?GENERATED_SBC_BLOCK_COUNT).
   55: 
   56: -define(GENERATED_BLOCK_COUNT, (?GENERATED_SBC_BLOCK_COUNT +
   57:                                 ?GENERATED_MBC_BLOCK_COUNT)).
   58: -define(GENERATED_CARRIER_COUNT, ?GENERATED_SBC_BLOCK_COUNT).
   59: 
   60: allocations_test(Args, Plain, PerAlloc) ->
   61:     run_test(Args, fun(Node) ->
   62:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_all_alloc,
   63:                                [fun instrument:allocations/0, Plain]),
   64:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_per_alloc,
   65:                                [fun instrument:allocations/1, PerAlloc]),
   66:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_format,
   67:                                [#{ histogram_start => 512,
   68:                                    histogram_width => 4,
   69:                                    flags => [] },
   70:                                 fun instrument:allocations/1,
   71:                                 fun verify_allocations_output/2]),
   72:                 ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_format,
   73:                               [#{ histogram_start => 512,
   74:                                   histogram_width => 4,
   75:                                   flags => [per_process, per_port] },
   76:                                fun instrument:allocations/1,
   77:                                fun verify_allocations_output/2]),
   78:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_abort,
   79:                                [fun erts_internal:gather_alloc_histograms/1])
   80:              end).
   81: 
   82: allocations_enabled(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   83:     allocations_test(["+Meamax", "+Muatags", "true"],
   84:                      fun verify_allocations_enabled/1,
   85:                      fun verify_allocations_enabled/2).
   86: 
   87: allocations_disabled(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   88:     allocations_test(["+Meamax", "+Muatags", "false"],
   89:                      fun verify_allocations_disabled/1,
   90:                      fun verify_allocations_disabled/2).
   91: 
   92: allocations_ramv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   93:     allocations_test(["+Meamax", "+Muatags","true", "+Muramv","true"],
   94:                      fun verify_allocations_enabled/1,
   95:                      fun verify_allocations_enabled/2).
   96: 
   97: verify_allocations_disabled(_AllocType, Result) ->
   98:     verify_allocations_disabled(Result).
   99: 
  100: verify_allocations_disabled({ok, {_HistStart, _UnscannedBytes, Allocs}}) ->
  101:     true = Allocs =:= #{};
  102: verify_allocations_disabled({error, not_enabled}) ->
  103:     ok.
  104: 
  105: %% Skip types that have unstable results or are unaffected by +Muatags
  106: verify_allocations_enabled(literal_alloc, _Result) -> ok;
  107: verify_allocations_enabled(temp_alloc, _Result) -> ok;
  108: verify_allocations_enabled(sl_alloc, _Result) -> ok;
  109: verify_allocations_enabled(_AllocType, Result) ->
  110:     verify_allocations_enabled(Result).
  111: 
  112: verify_allocations_enabled({ok, {_HistStart, _UnscannedBytes, Allocs}}) ->
  113:     true = Allocs =/= #{}.
  114: 
  115: verify_allocations_output(#{}, {ok, {_, _, Allocs}}) when Allocs =:= #{} ->
  116:     %% This happens when the allocator is enabled but tagging is disabled. If
  117:     %% there's an error that causes Allocs to always be empty when enabled it
  118:     %% will be caught by verify_allocations_enabled.
  119:     ok;
  120: verify_allocations_output(#{}, {error, not_enabled}) ->
  121:     ok;
  122: verify_allocations_output(#{ histogram_start := HistStart,
  123:                              histogram_width := HistWidth,
  124:                              flags := Flags },
  125:                     {ok, {HistStart, _UnscannedBytes, ByOrigin}}) ->
  126:     AllHistograms = lists:flatten([maps:values(ByType) ||
  127:                                    ByType <- maps:values(ByOrigin)]),
  128: 
  129:     Origins = maps:keys(ByOrigin),
  130: 
  131:     PerProcess = lists:member(per_process, Flags),
  132:     PerProcess = lists:any(fun(K) -> is_pid(K) end, Origins),
  133: 
  134:     PerPort = lists:member(per_port, Flags),
  135:     PerPort = lists:any(fun(K) -> is_port(K) end, Origins),
  136: 
  137:     true = lists:all(fun(K) ->
  138:                              is_pid(K) or is_port(K) or is_atom(K)
  139:                      end, Origins),
  140: 
  141:     %% Do the histograms look alright?
  142:     HistogramSet = ordsets:from_list(AllHistograms),
  143:     Verified = [H || H <- HistogramSet,
  144:                 tuple_size(H) =:= HistWidth,
  145:                 hist_sum(H) >= 1],
  146:     [] = ordsets:subtract(HistogramSet, Verified),
  147: 
  148:     %% Do we have at least as many blocks as we've generated?
  149:     BlockCount = lists:foldl(fun(Hist, Acc) ->
  150:                                  hist_sum(Hist) + Acc
  151:                              end, 0, AllHistograms),
  152:     GenTotalBlockCount = ?GENERATED_BLOCK_COUNT,
  153:     GenSBCBlockCount = ?GENERATED_SBC_BLOCK_COUNT,
  154:     if
  155:         BlockCount < GenSBCBlockCount ->
  156:             ct:fail("Found ~p blocks, required at least ~p (SB)." ,
  157:                     [BlockCount, GenSBCBlockCount]);
  158:         BlockCount >= GenTotalBlockCount ->
  159:             ct:pal("Found ~p blocks, expected at least ~p (SB + MB).",
  160:                     [BlockCount, GenTotalBlockCount]);
  161:         BlockCount < GenTotalBlockCount ->
  162:             ct:pal("Found ~p blocks, expected at least ~p (SB + MB), but this "
  163:                     "may be due to MBCs being skipped if they're about to be "
  164:                     "scanned just as they're fetched from the carrier pool.",
  165:                     [BlockCount, GenTotalBlockCount])
  166:     end,
  167: 
  168:     ok.
  169: 
  170: %% %% %% %% %% %%
  171: 
  172: carriers_test(Args, Plain, PerAlloc) ->
  173:     run_test(Args, fun(Node) ->
  174:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_all_alloc,
  175:                                [fun instrument:carriers/0, Plain]),
  176:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_per_alloc,
  177:                                [fun instrument:carriers/1, PerAlloc]),
  178:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_format,
  179:                                [#{ histogram_start => 1024,
  180:                                    histogram_width => 4 },
  181:                                 fun instrument:carriers/1,
  182:                                 fun verify_carriers_output/2]),
  183:                  ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, test_abort,
  184:                                [fun erts_internal:gather_carrier_info/1])
  185:              end).
  186: 
  187: carriers_enabled(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  188:     carriers_test(["+Meamax"],
  189:                   fun verify_carriers_enabled/1,
  190:                   fun verify_carriers_enabled/2).
  191: 
  192: carriers_disabled(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  193:     carriers_test(["+Meamin"],
  194:                   fun verify_carriers_disabled/1,
  195:                   fun verify_carriers_disabled/2).
  196: 
  197: verify_carriers_disabled(_AllocType, Result) ->
  198:     verify_carriers_disabled(Result).
  199: 
  200: verify_carriers_disabled({error, not_enabled}) ->
  201:     ok;
  202: verify_carriers_disabled({ok, {_HistStart, Carriers}}) ->
  203:     verify_carriers_disabled_1(Carriers).
  204: 
  205: verify_carriers_disabled_1([]) ->
  206:     ok;
  207: %% literal_alloc and temp_alloc can't be disabled, so we have to accept their
  208: %% presence in carriers_disabled/test_all_alloc.
  209: verify_carriers_disabled_1([Carrier | Rest]) when
  210:         element(1, Carrier) =:= literal_alloc;
  211:         element(1, Carrier) =:= temp_alloc ->
  212:     verify_carriers_disabled_1(Rest).
  213: 
  214: verify_carriers_enabled(_AllocType, Result) ->
  215:     verify_carriers_enabled(Result).
  216: 
  217: verify_carriers_enabled({ok, {_HistStart, [_|_]=_Carriers}}) ->
  218:     ok.
  219: 
  220: verify_carriers_output(#{ histogram_start := HistStart,
  221:                           histogram_width := HistWidth },
  222:                        {ok, {HistStart, AllCarriers}}) ->
  223: 
  224:     %% Do the carriers look alright?
  225:     CarrierSet = ordsets:from_list(AllCarriers),
  226:     Verified = [C || {AllocType,
  227:                       InPool,
  228:                       TotalSize,
  229:                       UnscannedSize,
  230:                       Allocations,
  231:                       FreeBlockHist} = C <- CarrierSet,
  232:                 is_atom(AllocType),
  233:                 is_boolean(InPool),
  234:                 is_integer(TotalSize), TotalSize >= 1,
  235:                 is_integer(UnscannedSize), UnscannedSize < TotalSize,
  236:                                            UnscannedSize >= 0,
  237:                 is_list(Allocations),
  238:                 tuple_size(FreeBlockHist) =:= HistWidth,
  239:                 carrier_block_check(Allocations, FreeBlockHist)],
  240:     [] = ordsets:subtract(CarrierSet, Verified),
  241: 
  242:     %% Do we have at least as many carriers as we've generated?
  243:     CarrierCount = length(AllCarriers),
  244:     GenSBCCount = ?GENERATED_SBC_BLOCK_COUNT,
  245:     if
  246:         CarrierCount < GenSBCCount ->
  247:             ct:fail("Carrier count is ~p, expected at least ~p (SBC).",
  248:                 [CarrierCount, GenSBCCount]);
  249:         CarrierCount >= GenSBCCount ->
  250:             ct:pal("Found ~p carriers, required at least ~p (SBC)." ,
  251:                 [CarrierCount, GenSBCCount])
  252:     end,
  253: 
  254:     ok;
  255: verify_carriers_output(#{}, {error, not_enabled}) ->
  256:     ok.
  257: 
  258: carrier_block_check(Allocations, FreeHist) ->
  259:     AllocCount = lists:foldl(fun({_Type, Count, _Size}, Acc) ->
  260:                                      Count + Acc
  261:                              end, 0, Allocations),
  262: 
  263:     %% A carrier must contain at least one block, and the number of free blocks
  264:     %% must not exceed the number of allocated blocks + 1.
  265:     FreeCount = hist_sum(FreeHist),
  266: 
  267:     (AllocCount + FreeCount) >= 1 andalso FreeCount =< (AllocCount + 1).
  268: 
  269: %% %% %% %% %% %%
  270: 
  271: test_all_alloc(Gather, Verify) ->
  272:     Verify(Gather()),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: test_per_alloc(Gather, Verify) ->
  276:     [begin
  277:          Verify(T, Gather(#{ allocator_types => [T] }))
  278:      end || T <- erlang:system_info(alloc_util_allocators)],
  279:     ok.
  280: 
  281: test_format(#{ allocator_types := _ }, _, _) ->
  282:     error(badarg);
  283: test_format(Options0, Gather, Verify) ->
  284:     %% We limit format checking to binary_alloc since we generated the test
  285:     %% vectors there.
  286:     Options = Options0#{ allocator_types => [binary_alloc] },
  287:     Verify(Options, Gather(Options)),
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: test_abort(Gather) ->
  291:     %% There's no way for us to tell whether this actually aborted or ran to
  292:     %% completion, but it might catch a few segfaults.
  293:     %% This testcase is mostly useful when run in an debug emulator as it needs
  294:     %% the modified reduction count to trigger the odd trap scenarios
  295:     Runner = self(),
  296:     Ref = make_ref(),
  297:     spawn_opt(fun() ->
  298:                       [begin
  299:                            Ref2 = make_ref(),
  300:                            [Gather({Type, SchedId, 1, 1, 0, Ref2}) ||
  301:                                Type <- erlang:system_info(alloc_util_allocators),
  302:                                SchedId <- lists:seq(0, erlang:system_info(schedulers))]
  303:                        end || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  304:                       Runner ! Ref
  305:               end, [{priority, max}]),
  306:     receive
  307:         Ref -> ok
  308:     end.
  309: 
  310: hist_sum(H) -> hist_sum_1(H, tuple_size(H), 0).
  311: hist_sum_1(_H, 0, A) -> A;
  312: hist_sum_1(H, N, A) -> hist_sum_1(H, N - 1, element(N, H) + A).
  313: 
  314: %%
  315: 
  316: run_test(Args0, Test) ->
  317:     %% Override single-block carrier threshold for binaries to ensure we have
  318:     %% coverage for that path. generate_test_blocks builds a few binaries that
  319:     %% crosses this threshold.
  320:     %%
  321:     %% We also set the abandon carrier threshold to 70% to provoke more
  322:     %% activity in the carrier pool.
  323:     Args = Args0 ++ ["+MBsbct", "1", "+Muacul", "70"],
  324:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  325: 
  326:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, generate_test_blocks, []),
  327:     ok = Test(Node),
  328: 
  329:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, churn_memory, []),
  330:     ok = Test(Node),
  331: 
  332:     peer:stop(Peer).
  333: 
  334: generate_test_blocks() ->
  335:     Runner = self(),
  336:     Ref = make_ref(),
  337:     spawn(fun() ->
  338:               %% We've set the single-block carrier threshold to 1KB so one
  339:               %% ought to land in a SBC and the other in a MBC. Both are kept
  340:               %% alive forever.
  341:               SBCs = [<<I, 0:(1 bsl 10)/unit:8>> ||
  342:                       I <- lists:seq(1, ?GENERATED_SBC_BLOCK_COUNT)],
  343:               MBCs = [<<I, 0:64/unit:8>> ||
  344:                       I <- lists:seq(1, ?GENERATED_MBC_BLOCK_COUNT)],
  345:               Runner ! Ref,
  346:               receive
  347:                    gurka -> gaffel ! {SBCs, MBCs}
  348:               end
  349:           end),
  350:     receive
  351:         Ref -> ok
  352:     end.
  353: 
  354: churn_memory() ->
  355:     %% All processes spawned from here on have 'low' priority to avoid starving
  356:     %% others (e.g. the rpc process) which could cause the test to time out.
  357:     [begin
  358:          churn_list_to_binary(),
  359:          churn_processes(),
  360:          churn_ets()
  361:      end || _ <- lists:seq(1, erlang:system_info(schedulers))],
  362:     ok.
  363: 
  364: churn_processes() ->
  365:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun churn_processes/0, [{priority, low}]),
  366:     [Pid ! <<I, 0:128/unit:8>> || I <- lists:seq(1, 128)].
  367: 
  368: %% Nearly all types have a few allocations at all times but sl_alloc is
  369: %% often empty. list_to_binary on large inputs will yield and spill the
  370: %% state into an 'estack' which is allocated through sl_alloc.
  371: %%
  372: %% This is inherently unstable so we skip the verification step for this
  373: %% type, but there's still a point to hammering it.
  374: churn_list_to_binary() ->
  375:     List = binary_to_list(<<0:(1 bsl 20)/unit:8>>),
  376:     spawn_opt(fun() -> churn_list_to_binary_1(List) end, [{priority, low}]).
  377: 
  378: churn_list_to_binary_1(List) ->
  379:     _ = id(list_to_binary(List)),
  380:     churn_list_to_binary_1(List).
  381: 
  382: churn_ets() ->
  383:     spawn_opt(fun() -> churn_ets_1(ets:new(gurka, [])) end, [{priority, low}]).
  384: 
  385: churn_ets_1(Tab) ->
  386:     ets:insert(Tab, {gaffel, lists:seq(1, 16)}),
  387:     ets:delete_all_objects(Tab),
  388:     churn_ets_1(Tab).
  389: 
  390: id(I) ->
  391:     I.
